docs.title: 🌹 Roselite
docs.text:
A peer-to-peer static site hosting platform built on the Veilid DHT network. Publish and share your websites without centralized servers.

Get Started View on GitHub

docs.title: What is Roselite?
docs.text:
Roselite is a revolutionary approach to static site hosting that leverages the Veilid DHT (Distributed Hash Table) network to create a truly decentralized web hosting platform. Unlike traditional hosting services that rely on centralized servers, Roselite distributes your content across a peer-to-peer network, making it:

  • Censorship resistant - No single point of failure or control
  • Always available - Content persists as long as the network exists
  • Privacy-focused - Built on Veilid's privacy-first architecture
  • Cost-effective - No monthly hosting fees or server costs

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
graph LR
    A[Static Site] --> B[Roselite Bundle]
    B --> C[Veilid DHT]
    C --> D[Global Network]
    D --> E[Gateway Access]
    E --> F[Your Visitors]
  1. Bundle your static site files with Roselite
  2. Publish to the Veilid DHT network
  3. Share the gateway URL with your audience
  4. Access from anywhere in the world

docs.title: Quick Example
docs.text:
Here's how easy it is to publish a site with Roselite:

# Install Roselite
cargo install roselite

# Create a simple site
mkdir my-site && cd my-site
echo "<h1>Hello, Decentralized Web!</h1>" > index.html

# Bundle and publish
roselite bundle .
roselite publish site.tar.gz

# Your site is now live on the DHT!

docs.title: CLI Reference
docs.text: Complete reference for all Roselite command-line interface commands.

docs.title: Global Options
docs.text:
These options can be used with any Roselite command:

roselite [GLOBAL_OPTIONS] <COMMAND> [COMMAND_OPTIONS]
Option Description -h, --help Show help information -V, --version Show version information -v, --verbose Enable verbose output -q, --quiet Suppress non-error output --config <FILE> Use custom configuration file

docs.title: Commands Overview
docs.text: Command Purpose bundle Create a site bundle publish Publish a bundle to DHT gateway Manage gateway server status Check system status list List published sites info Get site information update Update an existing site delete Delete a site from DHT open Open a site in browser serve Serve local files config Manage configuration

docs.title: bundle
docs.text: Create a compressed bundle from a directory of static files.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: roselite bundle [OPTIONS] <SOURCE>

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • <SOURCE> - Directory containing static files to bundle

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Description Default -o, --output <FILE> Output bundle filename site.tar.gz --compression <TYPE> Compression algorithm gzip --exclude <PATTERN> Exclude files matching pattern - --include-hidden Include hidden files false --max-size <SIZE> Maximum total bundle size 100MB

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Bundle current directory
roselite bundle .

# Bundle with custom output name
roselite bundle ./public -o my-site.tar.gz

# Bundle with exclusions
roselite bundle . --exclude "*.log" --exclude "node_modules/*"

# Bundle with different compression
roselite bundle . --compression zstd

docs.title: Supported Compression Types
docs.text:
• gzip (default) - Good balance of speed and compression
  • zstd - Faster compression/decompression
  • bzip2 - Better compression ratio
  • none - No compression

docs.title: publish
docs.text: Publish a site bundle to the Veilid DHT network.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: roselite publish [OPTIONS] <BUNDLE>

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • <BUNDLE> - Path to the bundle file to publish

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Description Default --name <NAME> Human-readable site name - --description <DESC> Site description - --tags <TAGS> Comma-separated tags - --private Publish as private site false --ttl <SECONDS> Time-to-live in seconds 86400 --replicas <NUM> Number of replicas 3

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Basic publish
roselite publish site.tar.gz

# Publish with metadata
roselite publish site.tar.gz \
  --name "My Personal Blog" \
  --description "A blog about tech and life" \
  --tags "blog,personal,tech"

# Publish private site
roselite publish site.tar.gz --private

# Publish with custom TTL
roselite publish site.tar.gz --ttl 604800  # 7 days

docs.title: Output
docs.text:

docs.title: gateway
docs.text: Manage the Roselite gateway server.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: roselite gateway <SUBCOMMAND>

docs.title: start
docs.text:
Start the gateway server.

roselite gateway start [OPTIONS]
Option Description Default --host <HOST> Bind to host address localhost --port <PORT> Listen on port 3000 --cors Enable CORS headers false --daemon Run as background daemon false

docs.title: stop
docs.text:
Stop the gateway server.

roselite gateway stop

docs.title: status
docs.text:
Check gateway server status.

roselite gateway status

docs.title: restart
docs.text:
Restart the gateway server.

roselite gateway restart [OPTIONS]

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Start gateway on default port
roselite gateway start

# Start on custom host/port
roselite gateway start --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8080

# Start with CORS enabled
roselite gateway start --cors

# Start as daemon
roselite gateway start --daemon

# Check status
roselite gateway status

# Stop gateway
roselite gateway stop

docs.title: update
docs.text: Update an existing site with new content.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: roselite update <SITE_ID> <BUNDLE>

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text:
• <SITE_ID> - ID of the site to update
  • <BUNDLE> - Path to the new bundle file

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Description --name <NAME> Update site name --description <DESC> Update description --tags <TAGS> Update tags

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
# Update with new bundle
roselite update abc123def456789 new-site.tar.gz

# Update with new metadata
roselite update abc123def456789 new-site.tar.gz \
  --name "Updated Blog" \
  --description "New and improved!"

docs.title: delete

docs.title: Arguments

docs.title: Options

# Force delete without confirmation

docs.title: serve
docs.text: Serve local files through the gateway (for development).

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: roselite serve [OPTIONS] <DIRECTORY>

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • <DIRECTORY> - Directory to serve

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Description Default --port <PORT> Port to serve on 3001 --host <HOST> Host to bind to localhost --watch Auto-reload on changes false

docs.title: Example

roselite serve .

# Serve with auto-reload

docs.title: config
docs.text: Manage Roselite configuration.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: roselite config <SUBCOMMAND>

docs.title: show
docs.text:
Show current configuration.

roselite config show

docs.title: set
docs.text:
Set a configuration value.

roselite config set <KEY> <VALUE>

docs.title: get
docs.text:
Get a configuration value.

roselite config get <KEY>

docs.title: reset
docs.text:
Reset configuration to defaults.

roselite config reset

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Show all config
roselite config show

# Set gateway port
roselite config set gateway.port 8080

# Get a specific value
roselite config get network.bootstrap_nodes

# Reset to defaults
roselite config reset

docs.title: Exit Codes
docs.text:
Roselite uses standard exit codes:

Code Meaning 0 Success 1 General error 2 Invalid command line arguments 3 Network error (DHT connection failed) 4 File system error 5 Permission denied 6 Site not found

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: Variable Description Default ROSELITE_CONFIG Path to config file ~/.config/roselite/config.toml ROSELITE_CACHE_DIR Cache directory ~/.cache/roselite ROSELITE_LOG_LEVEL Log level info VEILID_BOOTSTRAP Bootstrap nodes Built-in list

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
export ROSELITE_LOG_LEVEL=debug
roselite status

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Get Roselite up and running on your system with these installation options.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before installing Roselite, ensure you have:

  • Rust (1.70.0 or later) - Install Rust
  • Git - For cloning repositories and version control
  • Operating System: Linux, macOS, or Windows

Veilid Dependency

Roselite uses the Veilid DHT network. The Veilid daemon will be automatically managed by Roselite, so no separate installation is required.

docs.title: Option 1: Install from Crates.io (Recommended)
docs.text:
The easiest way to install Roselite is using Cargo:

cargo install roselite

This will download, compile, and install the latest stable version of Roselite.

docs.title: Option 2: Install from Source
docs.text:
For the latest development version or to contribute:

# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/jdbohrman/roselite.git
cd roselite

# Build and install
cargo install --path .

docs.title: Option 3: Download Pre-built Binaries
docs.text:
Download pre-compiled binaries from the GitHub Releases page:

LinuxmacOSWindows 
# Download and extract (replace VERSION with actual version)
wget https://github.com/jdbohrman/roselite/releases/download/vVERSION/roselite-linux-x86_64.tar.gz
tar -xzf roselite-linux-x86_64.tar.gz

# Move to PATH
sudo mv roselite /usr/local/bin/

# Download and extract
curl -L https://github.com/jdbohrman/roselite/releases/download/vVERSION/roselite-macos-x86_64.tar.gz | tar -xz

# Move to PATH
sudo mv roselite /usr/local/bin/
  1. Download roselite-windows-x86_64.zip
  2. Extract the roselite.exe file
  3. Add the directory to your PATH

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
After installation, verify that Roselite is working correctly:

# Check version
roselite --version

# View help
roselite --help

# Test connectivity (this will start the Veilid daemon)
roselite status

Expected output: 

Roselite v0.1.0
Veilid DHT: Connected
Gateway: Running on http://localhost:3000
Status: Ready

docs.title: Default Configuration
docs.text:
Roselite works out of the box with sensible defaults. The configuration file is located at:

  • Linux/macOS: ~/.config/roselite/config.toml
  • Windows: %APPDATA%\roselite\config.toml

docs.title: Custom Configuration
docs.text:
To customize Roselite's behavior, create or edit the configuration file:

[network]
# Veilid DHT settings
bootstrap_nodes = ["bootstrap1.veilid.org", "bootstrap2.veilid.org"]
listen_port = 5150

[gateway]
# Gateway server settings
host = "localhost"
port = 3000
enable_cors = true

[storage]
# Local storage path for cached content
cache_dir = "~/.cache/roselite"
max_cache_size = "1GB"

[publishing]
# Default settings for publishing
compression = "gzip"
max_file_size = "10MB"

docs.title: "command not found: roselite"
docs.text:
Solution: Make sure Cargo's bin directory is in your PATH:

# Add to your shell profile (.bashrc, .zshrc, etc.)
export PATH="$HOME/.cargo/bin:$PATH"

# Reload your shell
source ~/.bashrc  # or ~/.zshrc

docs.title: "failed to connect to Veilid network"
docs.text:
Solution: Check your internet connection and firewall settings:

# Check if ports are blocked
telnet bootstrap1.veilid.org 5150

# Try with verbose logging
roselite -v status

docs.title: "permission denied" on Linux/macOS
docs.text:
Solution: Ensure the binary has execute permissions:

chmod +x /usr/local/bin/roselite

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If you encounter issues:

  1. Check the troubleshooting guide
  2. Search existing issues
  3. Open a new issue with:
  4. Your operating system
  5. Roselite version (roselite --version)
  6. Error messages
  7. Steps to reproduce

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that you have Roselite installed, you're ready to:

  1. Follow the Quick Start Guide to publish your first site
  2. Learn about configuration options
  3. Explore the CLI commands

Installation Complete!

You're all set! Roselite is ready to help you publish sites to the decentralized web.

docs.title: Publishing Guide
docs.text: Master the art of publishing sites to the decentralized web with Roselite.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Publishing with Roselite is a two-step process:

  1. Bundle - Package your static files into a compressed archive
  2. Publish - Upload the bundle to the Veilid DHT network

This guide covers advanced publishing techniques, optimization strategies, and best practices.

docs.title: 1. Prepare Your Site
docs.text:
Ensure your static site is ready for publication:

# Example with a Hugo site
hugo build

# Example with a Jekyll site  
jekyll build

# Example with a React app
npm run build

# Example with plain HTML
# No build step needed - just organize your files

docs.title: 2. Bundle Your Site
docs.text:
Create an optimized bundle:

# Basic bundling
roselite bundle ./public

# Advanced bundling with options
roselite bundle ./public \
  --output my-site-v1.0.tar.gz \
  --compression zstd \
  --exclude "*.map" \
  --exclude "*.log"

docs.title: 3. Publish to DHT
docs.text:
Upload your bundle to the network:

# Basic publish
roselite publish my-site-v1.0.tar.gz

# Publish with metadata
roselite publish my-site-v1.0.tar.gz \
  --name "My Awesome Site" \
  --description "A showcase of decentralized web hosting" \
  --tags "portfolio,tech,demo"

docs.title: Custom Bundle Configuration
docs.text:
Create a .roselite.toml file in your project root for automatic configuration:

[bundle]
# Output filename pattern
output = "site-{version}.tar.gz"

# Compression settings
compression = "zstd"
compression_level = 9

# File exclusions
exclude = [
    "*.log",
    "*.map", 
    "node_modules/**",
    ".git/**",
    "*.tmp"
]

# Include hidden files
include_hidden = false

# Maximum bundle size
max_size = "50MB"

[publish]
# Default metadata
name = "My Site"
description = "Powered by Roselite"
tags = ["static", "decentralized"]

# Publishing options
ttl = 604800  # 7 days
replicas = 5
private = false

With this configuration, you can simply run:

roselite bundle .
roselite publish

docs.title: Site Versioning
docs.text:
Manage multiple versions of your site:

# Publish version 1.0
roselite bundle ./v1.0
roselite publish site.tar.gz --name "My Site v1.0"

# Publish version 1.1 (new site ID)
roselite bundle ./v1.1  
roselite publish site.tar.gz --name "My Site v1.1"

# Update existing site (same site ID)
roselite bundle ./v1.1
roselite update <SITE_ID> site.tar.gz

docs.title: Private Sites
docs.text:
Publish private sites that require authentication:

# Publish as private
roselite publish site.tar.gz --private

# Generate access token
roselite token generate <SITE_ID>

# Share private URL
# https://gateway.roselite.org/private/<SITE_ID>?token=<TOKEN>

docs.title: Bundle Size Optimization
docs.text: Keep your bundles small for faster distribution:

docs.title: 1. Image Optimization
docs.text:
# Before bundling, optimize images
find ./public -name "*.jpg" -exec jpegoptim --max=85 {} \;
find ./public -name "*.png" -exec optipng -o7 {} \;

# Use modern formats
find ./public -name "*.png" -exec cwebp -q 80 {} -o {}.webp \;

docs.title: 2. Asset Minification
docs.text:
# Minify CSS
find ./public -name "*.css" -exec cleancss -o {} {} \;

# Minify JavaScript  
find ./public -name "*.js" -exec terser {} --compress --mangle -o {} \;

# Minify HTML
find ./public -name "*.html" -exec html-minifier --collapse-whitespace --remove-comments --output {} {} \;

docs.title: 3. Compression Comparison
docs.text:
Choose the best compression for your use case:

Algorithm Speed Ratio Best For gzip Fast Good General use zstd Very Fast Good Real-time sites bzip2 Slow Best Archival content

docs.title: Use a CDN Pattern
docs.text:
Deploy multiple gateways for better performance:

# Primary gateway
https://gateway.roselite.org/site/<SITE_ID>

# Regional gateways  
https://eu-gateway.roselite.org/site/<SITE_ID>
https://asia-gateway.roselite.org/site/<SITE_ID>

docs.title: Implement Caching Headers
docs.text:
Include cache-friendly metadata:

<!-- In your HTML pages -->
<meta http-equiv="Cache-Control" content="public, max-age=3600">
<meta http-equiv="ETag" content="v1.0">

docs.title: Hugo Integration
docs.text:
Create a Hugo deployment script:

#!/bin/bash
# deploy.sh

set -e

echo "🏗️  Building Hugo site..."
hugo --minify

echo "📦 Creating Roselite bundle..."
roselite bundle ./public --output "site-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S).tar.gz"

echo "🚀 Publishing to DHT..."
SITE_ID=$(roselite publish site-*.tar.gz --format json | jq -r '.site_id')

echo "✅ Site published!"
echo "🌐 URL: https://gateway.roselite.org/site/$SITE_ID"

# Clean up
rm site-*.tar.gz

docs.title: Jekyll Integration
docs.text:
Add to your _config.yml:

# _config.yml
plugins:
  - jekyll-roselite

roselite:
  bundle:
    exclude:
      - "*.scss"
      - "*.sass"
      - "_site/*.map"
  publish:
    name: "My Jekyll Blog"
    tags: ["blog", "jekyll"]

docs.title: Next.js Integration
docs.text:
Create a custom deployment command:

{
  "scripts": {
    "deploy": "next build && next export && roselite bundle ./out && roselite publish site.tar.gz"
  }
}

docs.title: Updating Sites
docs.text:
Update existing sites efficiently:

# Method 1: Update in place (preserves site ID)
roselite update <SITE_ID> new-bundle.tar.gz

# Method 2: Publish new version (new site ID)  
roselite publish new-bundle.tar.gz

# Method 3: Atomic updates (advanced)
roselite atomic-update <SITE_ID> new-bundle.tar.gz

docs.title: Content Staging
docs.text:
Set up staging environments:

# Publish to staging
roselite publish site.tar.gz \
  --name "My Site (Staging)" \
  --tags "staging" \
  --ttl 3600  # 1 hour TTL

# Promote to production
roselite promote <STAGING_ID> --name "My Site"

docs.title: Rollback Strategy
docs.text:
Prepare for rollbacks:

# Tag current version before updating
roselite tag <SITE_ID> "stable"

# Update site
roselite update <SITE_ID> new-bundle.tar.gz

# Rollback if needed
roselite rollback <SITE_ID> "stable"

docs.title: Content Validation
docs.text:
Validate your content before publishing:

# Check for sensitive files
roselite validate ./public

# Scan for security issues
roselite security-scan site.tar.gz

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
Implement access controls for sensitive content:

# Publish with access restrictions
roselite publish site.tar.gz \
  --private \
  --allowed-domains "*.example.com" \
  --allowed-ips "192.168.1.0/24"

docs.title: Content Integrity
docs.text:
Verify content integrity:

# Generate checksums
roselite checksum site.tar.gz

# Verify published content
roselite verify <SITE_ID>

docs.title: Site Health Monitoring
docs.text:
Monitor your published sites:

# Check site availability
roselite health-check <SITE_ID>

# Monitor multiple sites
roselite monitor site1 site2 site3

# Set up alerts
roselite alert create \
  --site <SITE_ID> \
  --condition "availability < 90%" \
  --webhook "https://hooks.slack.com/..."

docs.title: Usage Analytics
docs.text:
Track site usage:

# Get site statistics
roselite stats <SITE_ID>

# Export analytics data
roselite analytics export <SITE_ID> --format csv

docs.title: Bundle Too Large
docs.text:
# Check bundle size
roselite bundle . --dry-run

# Reduce size with better compression
roselite bundle . --compression bzip2

# Exclude unnecessary files
roselite bundle . --exclude "*.pdf" --exclude "videos/*"

docs.title: Network Timeouts
docs.text:
# Increase timeout
roselite publish site.tar.gz --timeout 300

# Use more replicas for reliability
roselite publish site.tar.gz --replicas 7

docs.title: DHT Connection Issues
docs.text:
# Check network status
roselite status

# Try different bootstrap nodes
roselite config set network.bootstrap_nodes "alt1.veilid.org,alt2.veilid.org"

# Debug connection
roselite -v publish site.tar.gz

docs.title: 📁 File Organization
docs.text:
• Keep related files together
  • Use descriptive filenames
  • Organize assets in subdirectories
  • Include a clear index.html

docs.title: 🗜️ Compression
docs.text:
• Use zstd for frequently updated sites
  • Use bzip2 for long-term archival
  • Exclude source maps and logs
  • Optimize images before bundling

docs.title: 🌐 Distribution
docs.text:
• Use descriptive site names and tags
  • Set appropriate TTL values
  • Consider geographic distribution
  • Monitor site health regularly

docs.title: 🔒 Security
docs.text:
• Never include sensitive data
  • Validate content before publishing
  • Use private publishing for internal sites
  • Implement proper access controls

docs.title: 📊 Performance
docs.text:
• Keep bundles under 50MB when possible
  • Use compression efficiently
  • Optimize assets before bundling
  • Monitor load times and availability

Pro Tip

Create a deployment pipeline that automatically builds, bundles, and publishes your site whenever you push changes to your repository. This ensures consistent deployments and reduces manual errors.

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text: Get your first site published to the decentralized web in just a few minutes!

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
In this guide, you'll:

  1. Create a simple static website
  2. Bundle it with Roselite
  3. Publish it to the Veilid DHT
  4. Access it through the gateway

Prerequisites

Make sure you have Roselite installed before proceeding.

docs.title: Step 1: Create Your First Site
docs.text:
Let's create a simple website to get started:

# Create a new directory for your site
mkdir my-first-roselite-site
cd my-first-roselite-site

# Create a basic HTML page
cat > index.html << 'EOF'
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>My First Roselite Site</title>
    <style>
        body {
            font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, sans-serif;
            max-width: 800px;
            margin: 0 auto;
            padding: 2rem;
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%);
            min-height: 100vh;
            color: white;
        }
        .container {
            background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1);
            padding: 2rem;
            border-radius: 10px;
            backdrop-filter: blur(10px);
        }
        h1 { color: #fff; text-align: center; }
        .emoji { font-size: 3rem; text-align: center; margin: 2rem 0; }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <div class="container">
        <h1>🌹 Welcome to My Roselite Site!</h1>
        <div class="emoji">🚀</div>
        <p>This website is hosted on the <strong>decentralized web</strong> using the Veilid DHT network. No traditional servers required!</p>
        <p>Built with ❤️ using <a href="https://github.com/jdbohrman/roselite" style="color: #fff;">Roselite</a></p>
    </div>
</body>
</html>
EOF

# Create an about page
cat > about.html << 'EOF'
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>About - My Roselite Site</title>
    <style>
        body {
            font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, sans-serif;
            max-width: 800px;
            margin: 0 auto;
            padding: 2rem;
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%);
            min-height: 100vh;
            color: white;
        }
        .container {
            background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1);
            padding: 2rem;
            border-radius: 10px;
            backdrop-filter: blur(10px);
        }
        nav { margin-bottom: 2rem; }
        nav a { color: #fff; margin-right: 1rem; }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <div class="container">
        <nav>
            <a href="index.html">Home</a>
            <a href="about.html">About</a>
        </nav>
        <h1>About This Site</h1>
        <p>This is a demonstration of decentralized web hosting using Roselite and the Veilid DHT network.</p>
        <p>Key features:</p>
        <ul>
            <li>No centralized servers</li>
            <li>Censorship resistant</li>
            <li>Privacy-focused</li>
            <li>Globally accessible</li>
        </ul>
    </div>
</body>
</html>
EOF

Your directory structure should now look like this: 

my-first-roselite-site/
├── index.html
└── about.html

docs.title: Step 2: Start the Roselite Gateway
docs.text:
Before publishing, start the Roselite gateway to handle requests:

roselite gateway start

Expected output: 

🌹 Roselite Gateway starting...
✅ Veilid DHT connected
🌐 Gateway running on http://localhost:3000
🚀 Ready to serve content!

Gateway Purpose

The gateway acts as a bridge between the traditional web and the Veilid DHT, allowing regular browsers to access your decentralized sites.

docs.title: Step 3: Bundle Your Site
docs.text:
Create a bundle of your site files:

roselite bundle .

This command will: - Scan all files in the current directory - Compress them into an optimized bundle - Generate metadata for DHT storage

Expected output: 

📦 Bundling site from current directory...
✅ Found 2 files (index.html, about.html)
📊 Total size: 2.1 KB
🗜️  Compressed to: 1.2 KB
💾 Bundle saved as: site.tar.gz

docs.title: Step 4: Publish to the DHT
docs.text:
Now publish your bundle to the Veilid DHT:

roselite publish site.tar.gz

This will: - Upload your bundle to the DHT network - Generate a unique content address - Register the site with the gateway

Expected output: 

🚀 Publishing site to Veilid DHT...
📡 Uploading to network... ⠋
✅ Site published successfully!

📍 DHT Address: VLD0:abc123def456...
🌐 Gateway URL: http://localhost:3000/site/abc123def456
🔗 Share URL: https://gateway.roselite.org/site/abc123def456

💡 Your site is now live on the decentralized web!

docs.title: Step 5: Access Your Site
docs.text: You can now access your site in several ways:

docs.title: Local Gateway
docs.text:
# Open in your default browser
roselite open abc123def456

# Or manually visit:
# http://localhost:3000/site/abc123def456

docs.title: Public Gateway
docs.text:
Share this URL with others: 

https://gateway.roselite.org/site/abc123def456

docs.title: Direct DHT Access (Advanced)
docs.text:
For applications with Veilid integration: 

VLD0:abc123def456...

docs.title: Step 6: Verify Your Site
docs.text:
Test that everything is working correctly:

# Check site status
roselite status abc123def456

# List your published sites
roselite list

# Get detailed info about your site
roselite info abc123def456

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text: Congratulations! 🎉 You've successfully published your first site to the decentralized web. Here's what you can do next:

docs.title: Publish a Real Site
docs.text:
Try publishing an existing static site:

# For a Hugo site
hugo build
roselite bundle public/
roselite publish site.tar.gz

# For a Jekyll site
jekyll build
roselite bundle _site/
roselite publish site.tar.gz

# For any static site generator
# 1. Build your site
# 2. Bundle the output directory
# 3. Publish the bundle

docs.title: Learn More
docs.text:
• Publishing Guide - Advanced publishing options
  • Gateway Usage - Running your own gateway
  • CLI Reference - Complete command reference
  • Configuration - Customize Roselite behavior

docs.title: Update Your Site
docs.text:
To update your site:

# Make changes to your files
echo "<p>Updated content!</p>" >> index.html

# Create a new bundle
roselite bundle .

# Publish the update (this will create a new version)
roselite publish site.tar.gz

# Or update the existing site reference
roselite update abc123def456 site.tar.gz

docs.title: Site Not Loading
docs.text:
If your site isn't accessible:

  1. Check gateway status: 

    roselite gateway status

  2. Verify DHT connection: 

    roselite status

  3. Check site status: 

    roselite status abc123def456

docs.title: Slow Loading
docs.text:
DHT propagation can take a few moments. If your site loads slowly:

  • Wait 30-60 seconds for DHT propagation
  • Try refreshing the page
  • Check your internet connection
